headline: Beef Bulgogi
description: Our best bulgogi recipe uses a sweet soy and sesame marinade. Also known as Korean BBQ beef, this thinly sliced grilled steak is easy to make at home.
name: Beef Bulgogi

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk soy sauce, green onion, sugar, garlic, sesame seeds, sesame oil, and pepper together in a bowl.
Place flank steak slices in a shallow dish. Pour marinade over top. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or overnight.
Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat, and lightly oil the grate.
Quickly grill flank steak slices on the preheated grill until slightly charred and cooked through, 1 to 2 minutes per side.

review.reviewBody: Ended up cooking this in a wok and it turned out great along side some rice. Can't wait to try on the grill this summer.

This was incredibly easy and delicious. We ate it as lettuce wraps and was perfect as just the meat and lettuce. We also did make a sriracha mayo and a quick pickled cucumber using rice vinegar that complemented the dish well.
I will definitely make this one again.
Pretty pretty good. I’ll use brown sugar to test the comments.
Excellent!

This was AH-MAZING!! I accidentally let this marinade for over a day and it came out so flavorful!! I did have to double it since I have a large family. It was definitely delicious and I will be making this over and over again. Thank you!!
I've made this so many times, I've lost count. When I want to make bulgogi, this is THE recipe I always use. Thanks so much for sharing!!

I've been using this recipe for years. When we have guests over and I cook, they are always amazed at how good this is, especially with some gochujang. They always ask when they can come back for some more. Great recipe!!!!!
Perfect and easy!
This was absolutely amazing, I followed some of the reviews and used brown sugar instead of white sugar. My picky eating teenager even liked it.
I added a little more soy sauce and minced garlic. Came out great.

Absolutely delicious!! Didn’t have flank steak so used a 1.70 pound flat iron steak and doubled the marinade amount. Let it marinate for about 3 hours and then put everything in a really hot wok set to high and in about 3 minutes it was perfect. Served with Thai rice noodles with a spicy szechuan sauce and some oven roasted garlic broccoli.
I used half the amount of sugar and it was fabulous - I was hoping for leftovers but the whole family kept going back for more
Loved the flavor but I would not "char" it on the grill. I like my meat a little less cooked. This app wont let me upload the picture tho

Loved it!! I made it for dinner this evening and my family devoured it! The beef I selected ended up being a little on the tough side. So next time I’m going to add a little lime juice prior to tenderize my beef better. But other than that my husband and I agree this recipe is for the books!!
Turned out great! Wonderful flavor I followed the instructions to a tee. The only change I made was to double the recipe because of the number of people I had to feed.
Meh; this recipe was nothing special. I followed it exactly and precisely with the attention to detail of a scientist, and the flavors were very forgettable.

This was delicious, although it doesn't really taste like any Bulgogi I've had before. I think next time I make it I'll leave out the sesame seeds and just sprinkle them on top. I also think I'll scale back just a bit on the garlic as it was strong. I did add 1/2 a grated pear to help to tenderize the meat. I wasn't able to grill the meat so I cooked it on the stove in a fry pan and once cooked there was a lot of liquid so I made a slurry of cornstarch/soy sauce/water and drizzled it in. It turned the liquid into a wonderful gravy. Will definitely make again!
This was so good, I made it twice in one week! I maintain a Keto diet, so I just swapped Swerve sweetener for the sugar. FANTASTIC! This will be on our regular rotation now.
Just stir fried it, this is soooooo good!!!

I made it under the broiler in the oven from previously cooked left over steak. My husband and I both liked it. I didn’t have the green onions and the sesame seed but used bagel seeds instead. I will make this again.
Yummy! I added carrots and potatoes, and doubled the marinade to have some for the rice. I made Sweet Thai Chile sauce from this sight to put over at the end. So good

love love LOVED it! made it just as instructed besides no sesame seeds because i didnt have any..but i got some for next time! i also topped it with green onion and cilantro. i made it just over a week ago and my husband has brought it up 3 times since!! i think he liked it more than me :)

Next time i make it i am going to use sirloin instead of flank the flank was a bit rough.

We had a Bulgogi recipe from Hello Fresh so I used this marinade for the flank steak and served over cooked jasmine rice and roasted carrots/zucchini with a drizzle of sour cream/Siracha. It’s delicious!!
love this recipe. I do however love the use of Gochujang here. it can be used for many marinades and lasts a long time in the fridge.

So good! I made some changes though. I used a tablespoon of brown sugar instead of white. I pureed half a pear, a small piece of fresh ginger, 4 garlic cloves, the soy sauce and sesame oil. After that was blended I added the green onion, red pepper flakes and black pepper. I let it marinate for about 30 minutes. I don't have a bbq so the meat was cooked in batches on the stove. It was so good! I stir fried sliced zucchini, red onion, mushrooms and green onion for the side and some plain white rice. This recipe is a keeper!
I made it just like the recipe says, and it tasted just like the Bulgogi we used to eat at our Koreans friends!

This sauce is way too bland; I made it per recipe only replacing yellow onion slices for the green onions, and the dish had barely any flavor. I usually buy a commercial bulgogi sauce and had hoped this recipe would allow me to make my own; this is not the right recipe though, and I will keep looking.

I have made this for the first time today and it was a huge hit with my daughter and myself. Although I did substitute the green onion for onion powder because I didn't have any green onions because I forgot them at the store. Also I used some of the Korean chili paste like half a tablespoon to kind of spice it up a little bit and it was awesome.

This is THE recipe for Beef Bulgori. Simple to make and has the authentic Korean flavor. I wouldn't add or subtract anything to this recipe. Except for me, I had to use honey instead of sugar. Awesome recipe. Thank you for sharing your mother's recipe.
my husband loves Bulgogi and this is one of his favorite recipes. I add a tad more spice when I make for myself but this recipe is amazing as is.

This was simple to make and not a lot of ingredients. Taste was delicious. I marinated for 24+hr and beef was tender. A nice recipe that could become a staple because the marinade is basically pantry items.
Made as directed was Really good, used thin sirloin steak (couldn’t find flank steak)
It was easy and excellent. I used cheap thin sliced chuck and it was a delicous main course with stir fry veggies and fried rice.
Great!

This recipe is super easy to make! 

I feel like it needs a few fillers like onions and mushrooms. Maybe a little extra sauce as well. I did go with ribeye tonight which was a perfect fit for our taste buds... I would suggest putting your meat in the freezer for 20-30 minutes to make more even slices. It also makes it easier to slice.

Marinated 26 hours. Rain kept me from grilling and I fried in a pan— this recipe still works. I recommend you give this a try. It really isn’t hard sitting in the the refrigerator is doing the hard work. ??

Delish! I’m sorry that when I visited South Korea that I didn’t try it but there was so much delicious food, I never got to this! I followed the recipe except used brown sugar as many reviewers recommended and black sesame seed. I did refrigerate over night. The result was tasty, tender with a wonderful flavor. My husband loved it. Will make again.

I liked this recipe as it is super fast. I opted for pan frying the beef. It was all good and very quick. I did however forgot to add teh sugar but next time I will do so and maybe add less to my taste. Served it with a leftover rice that I transformed into egg fried rice. It was very good but most importantly fast as long as you prep everything. Prepping is vital in this kind of recipe if going for the pan fried route.
I had to make 3 batches of the sauce for 1 1/2 lbs. Of meat. Should have made another batch for the finished product as it was very dry. But it was very good. My hubby and I both enjoyed it.

This recipe is so bomb! I was trying to recreate a burrito from one of my favorite restaurants that closed, this bulgogi recipe was spot on. 
I made a couple adjustments from reading other reviews. I froze the meat for a half hour which made it very easy to slice thin, I used brown sugar instead of white and also cooked it over the stove top on high heat. Marinated the meat for 6 hours. 

I put this in a warm tortilla along with lime and cilantro infused rice, diced onions, lettuce, kimchi and of course the bulgogi. I also drizzled some of the marinade over the meat after. My husband had TWO freaking burritos! Next time I will try it with a fried egg and avocado. This is definitely going to be one of my staple recipes. Thank you!!
Really good! I oopsed on too much sesame seed oil! Used it to brown the beef. But I rescued it with a tablespoon of peanut butter and some lemon!!!
The recipe is excellent as is! I wouldn't change a thing. This is the second time I have made it and everybody loves it. Of course I serve it with white rice.

This might be one of the best things I've ever made! My Hawaiian hubby said our house smelled just like his mom's house growing up-- all the right flavors! I made a few adjustments for his tastes: I used brown sugar, half a smashed kiwi, and I added some grated ginger, Sriracha and red pepper flakes to give it some heat. Since I added the kiwi, I cut the marinating time down to 4 hours. I seared it in a hot skillet and it was perfect. So tender! We paired it with an egg roll, white rice and Mac salad, plate lunch style. Yum!

Thanks to the other reviews for the tips on sugar, kiwi, and partially freezing it for easier cutting!!
This is a family favorite and my oldest son's favorite meal
Great recipe!
Best bulgogi recipe I've found so far. Thanks so much for sharing!

Love this recipe! I used thin beef round instead of flank just because it’s easier for me to cut and it’s thin. I marinate it for about 5-6 hours but there have been times it was marinated for less and still came out delicious! This is definitely a must try.
Really delicious, though I would cut the amount of sesame seeds in half next time - mainly just personal preference, it felt almost borderline sesame-crusted and that was too much for me.
this one is so good and easy. very easy seasonings. truly recommended.

This is a keeper! I used sirloin instead of flank steak and subbed brown sugar for white. I served it in lettuce wraps but can't wait to try it in steamed buns. We served it with blistered green beans sautéed in butter and soy sauce - great pairing.
Came out great! Served as a wrap using bib lettuce with a side of basmati rice. After grilling added a touch of gochujang sauce to the meat for additional (traditional) flavor!
Amazing. I used the remaining marinade with Asian mix vegetables and rice. SO good
Delicious and easy!!

Very easy, pretty good. Not 5 star for us, but we have a different, very flavorful favorite flank steak recipe that is similar to this. Added just a splash of rice vinegar, and I'm glad I did for both flavor and to tenderize a bit. Overall, this is good and I would make it again. Great weeknight easy meal served with rice, broccoli, and a side salad.

I have made this 2-3 times and my son and I love it. Great taste and when marinated properly, fairly tender. Will continue to make this one, especially when moms outta town, as flank steak isn't her thing.
Used 6T of soy sauce instead of 5. Otherwise, this was a perfect recipe.

I LOVE THIS RECIPE!!! VERY EASY TO MAKE! I DIDN'T USE A GRILL BECAUSE I WANTED MEAT VERY TENDER SO I COOKED IN A NON STICK POT WITH A LID AND ALLOWED IT TO SIMMER AND TENDER MORE!!! I HAD TO ADD THE KOREAN PASTE AND POWDER!!! LOVED IT!! I WILL DEFINETLY MAKE AGAIN!!!! ENJOY

This is a great recipe. I put it in the marinade and then throw it in the freezer for a few hours to make it easier to slice thinly. After slicing, I put it back in the marinade so that it sits for at least 6 hours or so. I usually just make this on stove rather than the grill and it turns out great, very yummy with rice. Will try the brown sugar instead of white sugar next time.
It was fabulous , but i only used 1/2 a teaspoon sugar and i am glad as it was perfect
Loved it!! Will surely be making this again in the future

I was looking for something different to do with flank steak and saw all the positive reviews and decided to give this a try. The only change I made was halving the garlic because it seemed like a lot to me. For us, it tasted perfect that way. Everyone agreed that this one is a keeper! Thank you for sharing.
super good!
I love it! I've made it several times...I am honestly hooked!

Family said this was the best meal all week! Lower sodium/sugar edits: (sub equal parts) amino acid for soy sauce, golden monk fruit for sugar. For ease, I did put this in my Insta Pot (meat setting) and it turned out fantastic.

I’ve never made Beef Bulgogi before, but this definitely made its way into the “Favorite” folder. So easy to make too! Started it in the Marina around 10:30am and cookies 9 hours later. It was fabulous. Followed the recipe ingredient by ingredient and slightly froze the Flank Steak to make cutting it into thin strips easier. We simply served it over white rice and even the kids loved it.
Great and easy recipe! Just tried it today. Came out perfect. I tweaked it with brown sugar instead of white. My son is a picky eater and he likes it.
I will make it again. Sent it to my daughter.
Fantastic. Didn't have green onion, so used yellow and doubled as I had more meat. I marinated for 2 hrs. Family loved it! Thank you.
I love korean food! This recipe is amazing. I have attempted to make bulgogi before and it was never quite right. Then I found this gem! Top it with kimchi and it’s so delicious!
Too salty the way it is written

Made the recommended suggestion and used 2 1/2 tablespoons brown sugar instead of white sugar and added about 4 cloves of garlic. Made two pounds and there wasn't a bit leftover...family loved it!!!!!
after i made this i pur it on king's hawallan rolls and made sliders , top the meat with swiss cheese, cooked just until the cheese was melted. it was sooo good.
very good, quick and easy
I made this with Quorn (meat substitute) - I know, sacrilege! - and it was AWESOME!! I think its important to use fresh garlic. Gochujang is great, I add it to my ramen broth. so great.

OK, SO listen, I have been using this recipe for YEARS. I know you see tons of recipes that praise something and it ends up being awful. I am telling you I make this at least once a month for 5 or so years now. It's that good. The only thing I would mention is to take meat off grill before you think it's done because it will continue to cook after you remove from grill and it comes out even juicier. OMG i love this recipe.
Awesome recipe. Are used skirt steak and marinated it overnight. I grilled it and then cut it into strips.

TOO SALTY!! I used reduced sodium organic tamari soy sauce. I may try it again, with less soy or substitute liquid aminos instead. Definitely needs the hot pepper, which should be listed in the ACTUAL RECIPE and not merely mentioned in the descriptive blurb. The meat was tender which is why I gave this 2 stars instead of 1.
I loved this recipe! Very tasty. I used 1tbs of stevia instead of sugar.
My family loves this dish either grilled or stir fried. It is delicious and healthy and fun for kids to assemble. I serve it with.pickles and gochujang mixed with honey and sesame oil.
Loved this recipe, perfect bulgogi and only marinaded it for 1 hour. Made white rice and some kimchi as sides. Perfection.
Tender and flavorful. Great recipe. No changes but I did let it marinate for 48 hours before broiling for about 5 minutes. Served with white rice and baby bok choy.

I never rate recipes and rarely repeat them often, but this one is so good it's in the weekly rotation and the entire family loves it. Instead of soy, we use coconut aminos and honey instead of sugar. This is also amazing on salmon.
One of my favorite dishes my mom made growing up. She uses ground chuck roast, thinly sliced, marinade using the brown sugar, refrigerate for a couple of days, then slow cook.
love Bulgogi, and this recipe nails it.. even my picky kid loves it , always make it as written

Run the meat through a food processor using the slicing blade. Experiment once to try if you’re unsure. It slices it super fine. But once you grill it it comes out soft as butter. Saves so much time in slicing super thin. I can do four steaks in two minutes. It does resemble ground beef but once you cook it you’ll see it cooks up in super small strips. This method allows it to absorb the marinade really well. Great marinade.
I've made this several times per recipe instructions and it turns out fabulous every time. I cook it on my cuisinart griddler and it takes 2 minutes on high to cook. Delicious.
Very good! I would have rated 5* but decided to add minced ginger and some red pepper flakes to give it the snap it needed.
This was so good and so easy to make. We rolled it up in lettuce with rice. Will definitely make this again

I made this EXACTLY how the recipe said! To me, and my family, the sesame oil was WAY too strong! We could barely taste the other flavors! I will make it again but will make a few changes. Thanks for posting
Really good. We had the ground beef bulgogi bowls from Hello Fresh and decided to try to make our own... this is spot on. I left out the scallions because I sautéd some into the meat. DELICIOUS!

I used brown sugar, as I saw that several people recommended that, otherwise followed recipe exactly. Had to cook on stove top as it was pouring out and our grill is exposed to the outdoors with no cover. Flavor was good, not great, and it may have been the meat cut, but was a little tough. My husband loved it. I am not a beef person, so maybe that is why I wasn't as taken with it, so based on my husband's reaction, I give it a four.
We loved it so much, we made it twice in one week! Had to use the broiler but still wonderful
Awesome and beautiful.

Simple and delicious, this is the 2nd time I've made beef bulgogi using this recipe. I marinated the flank beef for a little over 36 hours unintentionally, but the meat came out perfectly tender and flavorful after 1.5 minutes per side over high heat charcoals. I serve the beef with rice in lettuce wraps.
It's truly amazing.
This was really good. Added the suggested red paste, onion shredded carrots, and broccoli.

I had not ever had bulgogi but my son loves it. So, I decided to try out the recipe. I followed it exactly the first time with the exception of using brown sugar over regular sugar as many suggested and he thought it was great, except he would have liked a little more sauce. So this time, I doubled the marinade. After removing the meat from the marinade, I boiled it up and let it thicken a bit so that he could pour a little over his rice. AMAZING!!!!

I've been making this for years now, my family loves this! I have a grill pan that I use on the stovetop when the weather isn't good for grilling outside and either way it turns out great. Freeze for about 30 min before slicing and double the sauce. Serve with steamed rice, green lettuce and julienned carrots, cucumbers and bell pepper to create lettuce wraps. Or just eat on its own!
